Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness due to counsel incompetence
Reasonableness of Board's findings on subjective fear and re-availment
Application_Facts: Counsel failed to submit critical evidence (arrest warrant)
Court_Ruling: Case remanded for reconsideration by a reconstituted Board panel
Defendant_Behavior: Inconsistent behavior regarding fear and return to Lebanon
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness, transparency, and justification of Board decisions
Procedural_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness due to incompetent counsel
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility findings due to lack of submitted evidence
Application_Basis: Past experiences in country of origin
Evidence_Assessed: Absence of arrest warrant in record
Governing_Rule: Board decisions must be reasonable, transparent, and justified
Harm_Assessment: Risk of removal despite potential fear due to procedural unfairness
Cause_Description: Refugee claim denial due to lack of credible evidence and inconsistent behavior
Evidence_Handling: Critical evidence not submitted by counsel
Evidence_Issues: Impact of unsubmitted evidence on credibility
Evidence_Assessment: Board relied on absence of evidence to assess credibility
Decision_Rationale: Findings on subjective fear and re-availment were reasonable but require reconsideration due to procedural fairness breach
Evidentiary_Issues: Counsel incompetence leading to failure to present key evidence
